content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Merged three articles covering survey creation workflows (manual, template-based, and engagement-specific) with PRD enhancements for customization and organization. All three articles share the same core workflow: create → select participants → configure settings → distribute. PRD adds customization of engagement questions and improved survey organization.

Merged four articles covering survey analysis: two domain-specific (satisfaction, work environment), two AI-powered analytics (dashboards, reports). All share analysis workflow: collect → review trends → segment by department/role → take action. PRD adds time-trend visualization and demographic filtering. AI Reports/Dashboards provide advanced analytics layer.

Specialized survey type for performance management. Distinct from general surveys due to multi-participant groups (self, manager, peers, direct reports) and feedback categories. Covered by dedicated article with no PRD enrichment needed.
Article covers sharing survey results via magic links and exporting to Excel. PRD context includes account manager review workflows for insurance satisfaction data.
Article covers designing, distributing, and analyzing short-cycle pulse surveys. PRD context includes survey fatigue risks from automation and frequency management.
Standalone article on document type management. Not directly related to survey feature but included in batch. Kept separate as it covers different workflow area.
Single ticket addressing inability to reopen surveys, add participants dynamically, or delete completed surveys. Impacts exit interview and probation review workflows.
Single ticket on Bayzat AI Report Builder inability to generate cross-module reports combining Payroll and Leave Management data. Users forced to manual compilation.
Single ticket on lack of comprehensive admin-level controls for hiding UI elements, announcements, and menu items. Some features remain visible despite admin panel attempts to disable.
Single ticket on insurance e-card management restricted to employee self-service, preventing super admin from performing document management tasks.
Single ticket on Hotjar integration lacking robust user attribute mapping and identification mechanisms for survey tracking.

product_context.title: Opportunity Assessment - Surveys & Engagement Improvements
product_context.why_built: Enhance the surveys and engagement module to improve user experience, increase adoption, and retain existing users. Current adoption is low (~19% UAE, ~25% KSA of eligible companies; only ~20 of 700 insurance clients use health insurance feedback surveys). Key improvements include automating health insurance surveys for GH insurance clients, adding time trends to engagement scores, enabling customization of engagement questions, improving anonymous response handling, and better organizing survey management for companies with high survey volumes.
key_design_decisions: Automate health insurance surveys only for GH insurance clients to reduce manual effort while maintaining customer control
Add time-series trend visualization to engagement scores to help admins track progress over time
Enable customization of engagement survey questions to allow companies to tailor questions to their specific needs
Enhance anonymity protections to encourage honest feedback while restricting identifying queries
Implement improved survey organization (categorization, filtering, search) to handle high survey volumes
Integrate demographic data (department, gender) from Employee Records module to enable segmented analysis
Balance automation with customer control to avoid upsetting clients who prefer manual survey management
Enhance anonymous response protection to prevent admin identification of individual respondents while maintaining analytics capabilities
Implement survey categorization and improved navigation to help companies with high survey volumes organize and find surveys easily
Balance automation benefits against survey fatigue risks by allowing frequency control

detected_integrations.description: Handles survey distribution, completion reminders, and expiry notifications for documents. Sends survey invitations and deadline reminders to employees.
Survey creation and management available on both web and mobile. Employees can respond to surveys on either platform and switch between them.
Provides demographic data (department, gender, role) for survey segmentation and analysis. Enables filtering and grouping of survey results by organizational dimensions.
Triggers automated health insurance satisfaction surveys for insurance clients. Provides client identification for automated survey distribution.
360-degree review surveys are part of performance management workflow. Engagement data may inform PM decisions.
Powers AI-assisted survey question generation, AI Reports, and AI Dashboards for enhanced survey analysis and insights.
Provides trend visualization, heatmaps, and time-series analysis of engagement scores. Enables export of survey results to Excel for further analysis.
Optional integration to share survey announcements and results with company employees.
File sharing feature lacks module selection, restricting document management workflows on mobile platform.
Shares health insurance satisfaction data and survey insights with Account Managers for client review and relationship management.
Report generation currently limited to single-module data. Cannot combine Payroll and Leave Management data in cross-module reports.
User attribute mapping and identification mechanisms are incomplete, limiting survey tracking and user behavior analytics.
Document management restricted to employee self-service; admin users cannot perform management tasks.

what_to_do.task: Create Employee Survey Using Templates or Manual Questions
steps: Navigate to Insights > Engagement > Surveys
Click 'New Survey' or 'Create Survey'
Choose creation method: Select template OR Start from scratch
If using template: Select predefined survey template (e.g., engagement, satisfaction, work environment)
If starting from scratch: Manually add questions or use AI generation
Select question types from available options (multiple choice, free text, NPS scale, opinion scale)
Add survey participants using filters (department, job role, location, registration status)
Configure survey details: Set survey period (minimum 10 days, recommended 30 days), Enable/disable anonymity, Set sharing options (company newsfeed), Configure notification settings
Review survey preview
Schedule survey launch or publish immediately
Monitor unregistered employees (system will highlight them)
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Survey is created, configured with targeted participants, and scheduled or published. Employees receive notifications and can begin responding. HR Admin can view survey status and response rates.
rules_and_constraints: Requires HR Admin or Super Admin role to create surveys
Company Survey Creator role can only see and edit their own surveys
Can only select from predefined question types
Surveys can be edited before they go live; cannot edit after responses begin
Can duplicate existing surveys to save time
Unregistered employees will be highlighted and cannot receive survey
Minimum survey duration is 10 days; recommended is 30 days
At least 1 scale question required for engagement surveys linked to engagement drivers
edge_cases: Unregistered employees will be highlighted in participant selection
Can cancel scheduled surveys from web or mobile before launch
Can edit scheduled surveys before they go live
Survey fatigue risk if surveys are too frequent — balance survey frequency with employee experience

what_to_do.task: Create Engagement Survey with Predefined Drivers
steps: Navigate to Insights > Engagement > Surveys
Click 'New Survey' and select Engagement Survey template
Review predefined engagement driver questions or customize them
Add custom questions if needed (optional)
Ensure at least 1 scale question is assigned to each engagement driver
Select survey participants using filters (department, location, employee type)
Configure survey settings: Set survey period (recommended 30 days), Enable anonymity, Configure notification reminders
Review survey structure and questions
Publish survey
Monitor responses and send reminders to non-responding employees only
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Engagement survey is created with predefined drivers, targeted to specific employee segments, and published. System tracks engagement scores and can display trends over time (per PRD enhancements).
rules_and_constraints: At least 1 scale question is required for each engagement driver
Questions are linked to predefined engagement drivers
Recommended survey duration is 30 days
Minimum survey response time is 10 days
Reminders are only sent to non-responding employees
Engagement questions can be customized per company needs (per PRD)

Employees not registered on Bayzat will be highlighted and cannot participate
Survey fatigue risk if engagement surveys are run too frequently

what_to_do.task: Create Survey Using AI-Powered Question Generation
steps: Navigate to Insights > Engagement > Surveys
Click 'New Survey' and select 'Start from Scratch'
Click 'Start from AI' or 'Get started' in the AI section
Compose a detailed AI survey prompt starting with 'Create a survey'

In the prompt, specify: Survey topic (required), Survey purpose (optional), Additional context like industry or employee type (optional), Preferred question types (optional), Desired number of questions (optional)
Click 'Generate' to create initial survey questions
Review generated questions for relevance and accuracy
Edit individual questions if needed (rephrase, adjust options, change question type)
Regenerate questions if the initial output is not relevant
Delete or add additional questions as needed
Proceed to participant selection and survey configuration
what_to_do.expected_outcome: AI generates a customized set of survey questions based on the user's prompt. User can refine, edit, or regenerate questions until satisfied, then proceed with standard survey creation workflow.
rules_and_constraints: Prompts should start with 'Create a survey'
Be specific about survey topic for better results
Can specify question types in the prompt
Optional to set number of questions
Can include industry or employee type details for more tailored questions
Manual editing of AI-generated questions is allowed
Users can regenerate questions if initial output is unsatisfactory
edge_cases: Users can regenerate questions multiple times until satisfied
Vague or generic prompts may produce less relevant questions — specificity improves quality
AI-generated questions should be reviewed for company-specific context before publishing

Maximum of 30 questions per survey
Cannot edit surveys once participants start responding
Upward feedback (manager feedback) is optional
Surveys must have at least 1 question to be saved
AI survey generation requires careful prompt and category selection for best results

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Surveys cannot be edited or deleted after launch. Once a survey transitions to 'ongoing' or 'active' state, users cannot modify questions, add new questions, or remove the survey entirely. Any post-launch changes require engineering team intervention, blocking self-service survey management workflows.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Survey Report Export Feature Parity Gap
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Survey reporting functionality displays filtered data in the platform UI but does not support exporting the same views. Users can filter non-submitted surveys or view NPS scores in the UI, but these filters and visualizations are not available in downloadable report exports. Export functionality only supports completed submissions and lacks NPS score inclusion.

Surveys lack functionality to reopen existing surveys, dynamically add new participants to active surveys, or delete completed surveys. This prevents efficient management of recurring workflows such as employee exit interviews and probation reviews where surveys may need to be reused or extended.

Bayzat AI Report Builder cannot generate reports that combine data from multiple modules (e.g., Payroll and Leave Management). Users must manually extract and compile data from separate sources to create integrated reports, creating inefficiency and error risk.

Admin panel lacks comprehensive controls for hiding or disabling specific UI elements, feature announcements, and menu items. Some features remain visible to users even after admin attempts to disable them through settings, creating inconsistent user experiences and inability to fully customize the platform interface.

Insurance e-card and document management is restricted to employee self-service only. Super admin and HR admin users cannot perform critical document management tasks such as uploading, updating, or managing e-cards on behalf of employees, creating workflow bottlenecks for administrative personnel.

Hotjar integration lacks robust user attribute mapping and identification mechanisms. The platform cannot provide comprehensive user metadata within survey tracking, limiting analytics capabilities and user behavior insights.

Mobile app file sharing feature lacks module selection capabilities, forcing users into a single predefined workflow. Users cannot choose which module context to use when sharing files, restricting flexibility and creating friction in document management processes.
